comments.content: D is right as per the reference link
Link is for Cortex XDR, not for XSOAR.

discussion.content: Yep, when you create a Dashboard, you Share it, specify who to share it with and Read/Write or Read Only and once shared, you can add it to a Default Dashboard. Answer is 100% A

Having trouble finding the answer but A would be the most logical. Under Settings >> Users and Roles >> Scroll down to Default Dashboards and select the default dashboard for that role. You can choose the positions for all dashboards by clicking on them in the order you want them. However, I don't see custom dashboards in this field.

questions.question_text:
An engineer defined a dashboard which allows important metrics to be displayed. The engineer would like to make this dashboard the default dashboard.
How can it be accomplished?

choices.D: Right click on the dashboard tab and 'Set as Default'
choices.B: Use the server configuration key: default.dashboards
choices.A: Default Dashboard can be defined by 'Role'
choices.C: Save the dashboard as a widget and apply it to all users

discussion.content: This question makes no sense. 'Malicious' is not a dbotscore. Bad is so if you equate malicious to bad it is '3'. However there is no property 'value' for DBotScore. So there are no answers correct. So the question is just badly worded. So A if you think dbotscore.value (which does not exist) or D but value 2 equates to 'Suspicious'...

comments.content: Whoops, B if you want to use '3' as the answer and D for Suspicious.

questions.question_text: How would context data be filtered to receive only malicious indicator values with DBotScore?

choices.D: Get DBotScore where DBotScore.Score (Larger or equals) 2
choices.A: Get DBotScore.value where DBotScore.Score (Larger or equals) 4

comments.content: go and try it. You'll see that it's B

choices.A: An automation script cannot execute an integration command and an integration command cannot execute an automation script
choices.D: An automation script can execute an integration command and an integration command can execute an automation script
choices.B: An automation script can execute an integration command and an integration command cannot execute an automation script
choices.C: An automation script cannot execute an integration command and an integration command can execute an automation script

questions.question_text: Can an automation script execute an integration command and an integration command execute an automation script?

discussion.content: Probably AC. When you run an instance to fetch, assuming it's set for 1 minute and not days etc, when it "attempts" to fetch it will show a result on the integrations page which you can click on to determine if successful or not.

questions.question_text: Which two options will troubleshoot an integration's fetch incidents command? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Create a one task playbook with a fetch-incident command
choices.A: In the instance settings, enable the fetch incidents parameter and wait for one minute

questions.question_text:
Incidents need to be filtered by all of the following criteria:
1. Status `" Pending
2. Exclude Category `" Job
3. Severity `" High
4. Owner `" None (No owner assigned)
5. Type `" Phishing
6. Email Subject `" `You have won a million dollars`
What is the correct query syntax for the above incident search filter?

discussion.content:
I think it should look something like this:
status:Pending -category:job and severity:High owner: type:Phishing emailsubject:"You have won a million dollars"

Selected Answer: C
C is correct.
